Pre-Game Insights: Sri Lanka defeated India by 32 runs in the second ODI at Colombo on 4 August
India chased a target of 241 runs but could only score 208 runs and were bowled out in 42.2 overs
Sri Lanka posted 241 runs for India to chase
India's Arshdeep Singh and Kuldeep Yadav were on crease when India was bowled out
Post-Match Reflections: Jeffrey Vandersay became the player of the match
The defeat ends India's sequence of 11 consecutive bilateral series (2+ matches) wins in ODIs against Sri Lanka
Miscellaneous Highlights: Chasing a target of 241 runs, India could hardly managed to score 208 runs and were bowled out in 42.2 overs
Sri Lanka's Avishka Fernando scored 40 runs, Dunith Wellalage smashed 39 runs
Kamindu Mendis hit 40 runs, while Kusal Mendis (30) and Charith Asalanka (25) contributed their bit
